text: So our second example is roughly a few hours.
Again this is in a trending like move, but what has happened on this day is we've had
a little bit of an open drive or we've had the market open at the start of the day
and very quickly we've seen some initiative being taken early on.
Now when we have these day types I tend to have sort of two ideas as to what can
occur over the course of the day.
in theory, remain intact. So the reason I draw this volume profile is to ensure that I constantly
remind myself as to that initiative that's taken place over the early part of the day.
Remember what we spoke about in module one and two when we spoke about initiative versus
responsive? And we said that when there's initiative there tends to be a natural
bias towards one side of the market. In this example that natural bias is towards the downside.
Now again as you'll see with the composite profile
is that it helps me to one, determine where the good trade location is
which is ahead of the area of
low trade where that first orange line is
And then more importantly, it helps me to remain in the trade until such a time that we find
discount prices.
And we can see once we've found those discount prices, the market very quickly auctions
back up towards the top orange line.
So again, we can see how volume profiling over a composite time frame can aid us in
not just decision making, not just staying in the right trade for longer, not just
keeping us on the right side with the right idea in mind.
Let's look at another example.
